meanings.definition: To lose or be deprived of something, especially by accident or misfortune.
meanings.sent1: She tyned her favorite toy in the park.
meanings.sent2: He tyned his way back home after getting lost.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tyned its acorn and couldn't find it again.
meanings.sent4: The wind tyned away the leaves from the tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The magician tyned the coin from his hand, making it disappear.

meanings.sent1: The fork had tyned edges for cutting.
meanings.sent2: She wore a tyned crown on her head for the costume party.
meanings.sent3: The tyned fence kept the rabbits out of the garden.
meanings.sent4: The tyned comb helped detangle her hair easily.
meanings.sent5: The tyned star on top of the Christmas tree sparkled brightly.

meanings.definition: To become separated into branches or divisions.
meanings.sent1: The river tyned into two smaller streams.
meanings.sent2: The road tyned off into different directions.
meanings.sent3: The family tyned at the crossroads, unsure which way to go.
meanings.sent4: The company tyned into separate departments for better organization.
meanings.sent5: The tree tyned into a beautiful canopy of green leaves.
